newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Copper, aluminium seen stuck in range.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Copper, aluminium seen stuck in range.

text.p: 3 MONTH CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
---------------VIEWS FROM THE MARKET - April 17 ---------------
Copper has found a comfortable range for the time being between $2,245 and $2,290, but continued upside failures could send prices down to probe the bottom of the band, traders and analysts said.
Aluminium may drift down to the February low of $1,534, but that is expected to hold, they added.
COPPER -
Having explored the upper and lower areas of the range, copper seemed content to remain above Monday's low of $2,245 and below Wednesday's high of $2,293 for the short term.
The 10-day moving average at $2,292 helped inhibit moves towards $2,300 on Wednesday while the 100-day moving average at $2,260 was to be watched on the downside.
One technical analyst noted that the 14-day/12-day stochastics were low at 15.
"I don't see it collapsing, I really don't see it doing much," he said.
Weakness might sending prices slipping to $2,220, but downside potential was not great in the short term, he added.
Chartist Harry Creates of broker AMT, however, said a sloping head and shoulders pattern was still intact and eventually could target $2,120, $2,040 or $1,980.
At 0755 GMT three months LME copper was quoted at $2,265/69, up $3/$4 from Wednesday's late close.
ALUMINIUM -
This market, like copper was seen largely holding in a $1,540-$1,565 range, with any downside move bottoming out at the year's low of $1,534.
"The appearance of a small bearish engulfing pattern on the candlestick chart indicates a test of support around $1,535," said broker Brandeis in a commmentary.
Broker Gerald agreed that the downside could be inviting.
"Look for a test of the $1,530/35 support now that it has failed to make any kind of run at the upside," it said.
But scope at the lower levels was limited since the market was oversold, analysts said.
"However, the market is looking rather oversold with the RSI at 32.1," Brandeis said. Another chartist noted that the 14-day/12-day stochastics were very low at nine percent.
Resisance was pegged around Monday's high of $1,566.
At 0805 GMT three months aluminium was quoted at $1,550/53, up $3 from Wednesday's late close.
--Eric Onstad, London Newsroom +44 171 542-8065
